feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows a discrepancy in daily wage formula calculation between leave policy and payroll settings. The payroll-side daily wage calculator takes precedence and overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions. The greyed-out display in leave policy indicates this override is intentional.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage formula in leave policy can be overridden by payroll settings, causing potential user confusion
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system does not correctly account for 366 days in leap years (specifically 2024) when calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity. This results in an incorrect total service period and gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using specific day counting and leap year adjustment methodologies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential need for more transparent gratuity calculation breakdown | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Day
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently account for February 29th in leap years, causing slight discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day (February 29th) inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration and gratuity calculations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked slightly differently than manual calculation, adding an extra day (622 vs 623 days). This minor discrepancy impacts gratuity calculation precision.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor inconsistency in days worked calculation method
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential need for more precise days worked calculation algorithm

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users may misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and challenge the resulting prorated salary amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Leave Salary Accrual
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary based on monthly working days, causing inconsistent leave salary accrual reporting
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations, causing different results. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to calculation mismatches.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently and may use different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to consistently prorate salaries for offboarded employees. When an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing, the system does not prorate the salary correctly and displays the full monthly amount instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration logic is inconsistent between past and future departure dates during payroll processing
known_issues.gap_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: Public holiday additions after leave request creation cause mismatches between HR and Payroll systems' daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions. The Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to the Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across different system configurations.

known_issues.title: Deduction Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave calculations. This results in deductions being calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary as configured in the policy.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month instead of the leave occurrence month, causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave was taken.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate is recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for consistent daily rate display that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Per Month Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is calculated based on a standard of 26 working days per month (313 working days per year, excluding 52 weekly offs).
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for employees working more or fewer than 26 days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify leave policy formulas when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or simultaneously with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366 Days in Leap Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amounts are consistently calculated with a small decimal discrepancy, resulting in amounts slightly lower than expected.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end of service settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Restriction
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include current month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Ambiguous Day Counting for Service Duration
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates partial years differently than manual expectations, using specific day counting methods and adjusting for leap years by potentially using 366 as a divisor.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies for end of service (EOS) benefits

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform uses a fixed divisor in policy configuration for daily wage calculations, which does not automatically adjust based on month length.

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage can be calculated using either 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impacts monthly accrual amounts
limitations.impact: Monthly leave salary accruals will fluctuate based on the number of working days in each month

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Potential inconsistent salary calculations between leave and proration scenarios

limitations.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ from traditional calendar-based expectations

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure dates are in the past, failing for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform currently lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
limitations.impact: Users cannot reliably modify or delete leave transactions without risking duplicate or persistent payroll deductions

limitations.title: Cannot Recalculate Deductions Retroactively
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot recalculate salary deductions retroactively when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed.
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments required for calculation discrepancies

limitations.title: Monthly Day Count for Unpaid Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations use actual calendar days for the month, requiring precise day counting for unpaid leave deductions.
limitations.impact: Accurate prorated salary deductions based on exact month days

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays

Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not correctly account for 366 days in leap years (specifically 2024) when calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity. This results in an incorrect total service period and gratuity amount calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using specific day counting and leap year adjustment methodologies.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Day
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently account for February 29th in leap years, causing slight discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates days worked slightly differently than manual calculation, adding an extra day (622 vs 623 days). This minor discrepancy impacts gratuity calculation precision.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users may misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and challenge the resulting prorated salary amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Leave Salary Accrual
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations, causing different results. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to calculation mismatches.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to consistently prorate salaries for offboarded employees. When an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing, the system does not prorate the salary correctly and displays the full monthly amount instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: Public holiday additions after leave request creation cause mismatches between HR and Payroll systems' daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions. The Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to the Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.

claims_to_validate.title: Deduction Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave calculations. This results in deductions being calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary as configured in the policy.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month instead of the leave occurrence month, causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave was taken.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Per Month Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is calculated based on a standard of 26 working days per month (313 working days per year, excluding 52 weekly offs).

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366 Days in Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amounts are consistently calculated with a small decimal discrepancy, resulting in amounts slightly lower than expected.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Restriction
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Day Counting for Service Duration
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling

claims_to_validate.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates partial years differently than manual expectations, using specific day counting methods and adjusting for leap years by potentially using 366 as a divisor.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform uses a fixed divisor in policy configuration for daily wage calculations, which does not automatically adjust based on month length.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment daily wage can be calculated using either 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impacts monthly accrual amounts

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure dates are in the past, failing for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform currently lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.

claims_to_validate.title: Cannot Recalculate Deductions Retroactively
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot recalculate salary deductions retroactively when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Day Count for Unpaid Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations use actual calendar days for the month, requiring precise day counting for unpaid leave deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
